name: Balendra (Balen) Shah
bio: Former Mayor of Kathmandu; campaigning on a platform of urban reform and the 'Gen Z' movement to challenge the political old guard.

name: K.P. Sharma Oli
bio: Chairman of CPN-UML and two-time Prime Minister; defending his long-held stronghold against new wave challengers.

name: Gagan Kumar Thapa
bio: President of Nepali Congress; shifted his constituency from Kathmandu to Sarlahi to lead the party's influence in the Madhesh region.

name: Rabi Lamichhane
bio: President of Rastriya Swatantra Party; running on an anti-corruption and good governance agenda.

name: Pushpa Kamal Dahal (Prachanda)
bio: Leader of the newly merged Nepali Communist Party; moved to Rukum to consolidate his party's traditional base.

name: Renu Dahal
bio: Two-time Mayor of Bharatpur; entering federal politics with a focus on large-scale infrastructure and women's leadership.

name: Kulman Ghising
bio: Former Chief of Nepal Electricity Authority; running with a focus on economic transparency and energy independence.

name: C.K. Raut
bio: Incumbent representative and Janamat Party leader; focused on agricultural reform and identity-based rights for the Terai.

name: Harka Sampang
bio: Former Mayor of Dharan; known for his grassroots labor-focused movement and water management projects.

name: Sobita Gautam
bio: Young advocate and former MP from Kathmandu 2; shifted to Chitwan to represent youth interests in a high-profile battle.

name: Rajendra Prasad Lingden
bio: Chairman of Rastriya Prajatantra Party; advocating for a constitutional monarchy and a return to a Hindu State.

name: Mahabir Pun
bio: Scientist and social entrepreneur; running independently to promote national research and innovation policy.
